managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.

Your feedback is very important to us and we can assure you that we will use this information to do everything possible to create an enjoyable experience for each of our guests. We hope to see you again soon!

review.reviewText: Nice room. Television was not good. Breakfast was great! No restaurants.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.

 We very much appreciate and value your feedback and will share it with our team. Your survey responses will serve as encouragement to all of our staff as we strive to continuously improve the quality of our services to provide an exceptional experience for our guests. It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.

 Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we hope your next visit will be even more pleasant than the previous one.

 Sincerely,
B M Patel

review.title: Surprisingly Good Experience
review.reviewText: Right from the start, upon check in we were treated with warmth and kindness from the desk clerk, Janmesh. he went WAY out of his way to help us and engage with my whole family. We were there to welcome in my son's twins at Mission hospital. Janmesh inquired each time we came in about the new family. On one day as we were leaving the parking lot Janmesh ran outside to give us a box of See's chocolate to give to our Daughter in law. I have traveled extensively in several countries and I can honestly say that I have never been given this type of positive personal attention. Without Janmesh this would have been an average hotel stay without becoming such a special memory for my whole family. Thank You Janmesh for adding to the the happiness of welcoming twins into our family.
review.positiveRemarks:
10 minute drive to the Mission Hospital.  Near the airport but the Hotel was quiet inside.
Breakfast was more complete than most.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel was clean and everything was in order

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to complete our online survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.

 We very much appreciate and value your feedback and will share it with our team. Your survey responses will serve as encouragement to all of our staff as we strive to continuously improve the quality of our services to provide an exceptional experience for our guests. It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.

 Thank you again for sharing your experience, and we hope your next visit will be even more pleasant than the previous one.

 Sincerely,
Nina

review.title: Perfect last night before early to SFO-airport
review.reviewText:
Very convienient last night stay because of five minutes from the International airport SFO and rentalcar delivery (means no stress with the traffic).
Breakfast included and opened even before 6 o'clock am! Easy parking outside ($6).

review.title: Great value, close to airport.
review.reviewText: We had a post-midnight arriving flight from Europe and were grateful for a clean, welcoming room.  Included breakfast was more than basic continental, even included biscuits and gravy as an option, as well as the standard scrambled eggs and make-your-own waffles.  Only down side was that the hotel shuttle stopped pick-ups from the airport at midnight, so we had to take a taxi, which cost about $15.00.  We were so tired at that point that we didn't even care.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room, comfortable bed and great pillows, accommodating staff, great included breakfast.

review.title: Pretty quiet,very convenient to airport
review.reviewText: We were only in town for about 17 hours total.  We quite literally went to the motel, cleaned up, slept, got up, showered,and left.  The breakfast claimed to have an omelet station, but it must have been "down" while we were there. We had scrambled eggs (which appeared to be real, not a powdered mix) and sausage....so not horrible, but no omelets like I was hoping for. The bathroom was clean, the bed was comfortable.  The pillows were not great, but I am an admitted pillow snob and have distinct tastes.  These had no depth or structure.  It was like my head was on the mattress even after folding in half.
review.positiveRemarks: It served it's purpose...a place to sleep while waiting to catch a morning flight.
review.negativeRemarks: Better pillows.  An omelet station that serves actual omelets. I didn't go there expecting luxury, so I was not disappointed.
review.locationRemarks: Fly in and out.  If you have a car, get over to Grand Avenue and go to the little Italian restaurant there.  That is an awesome place to eat, 5 minute

review.title: Very small and limited parking spCes
review.reviewText: For cost thought sheets should not have any holes. Sheets were clean though.
Very friendly and helpful staff. Tasty breakfast with omelette station.

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Great hot breakfast. Friendly staff. Clean, comfortable room.

review.title: Great location, quiet, comfortable, great people.
review.reviewText: Great place with great people and great breakfast.

review.title: Close to airport, basic room, excellent staff.
review.reviewText: The rooms are small and there is nothing fancy about this place, but it is conveniently located and the staff is very helpful and friendly.  The shuttle driver is so nice and such a hard worker!

The staff was very pleasant. Condition of room was just run down. The bed and pillows were not comfortable. The bathroom water faucet and bathtub faucet needed replacing. It was clean! After staying there, I think the price was high based on the age of the place. Again, the staff were very nice and hotel was clean.
Stayed for only a few days but it was nice and the assistant manager is a great person
Hotel was ok priced but very old dated looking carpet elevators bathrooms very wormed out and old

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good location, quiet, friendly staff. will definitely stay there again! Close to the freeway, gas stations and local amenities.

review.title: Cheap stay
review.reviewText: It was a basic hotel stay. We only stayed for a night. Room was clean. Breakfast was not good. They served fake eggs, waffles, biscuit and gravy, cereal, toast/muffins. The milk had a film an my kids didn't like how it taste. Overall ok experience.

review.title: Close to airport, bus stop into the city
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff was friendly, bed was comfortable, and rooms were clean.

I would stay here again
the sink was blocked in the bathroom and couldn't drian properly

review.title: Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: We had trouble finding the hotel late at night but once we did the room was, though a little worn, comfortable as was the bed.
review.positiveRemarks: It was fine for an airport stop over.
review.negativeRemarks: The furniture was a wee worn.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport though a bit hard to find being north of it and down the road past the other hotels in the area.

review.reviewText:
This was not a 3 star hotel. It's a stretch to give it 2. The rooms were worn, the blankets were stained, the towels were old. I asked for an extra blanket and were told they had none. The bathtub was so dirty I would not allow my daughter to take a bath. 
At check in the staff at desk was nice, but no staff could be found at check out.
The hotel was conveniently located to airport and other attractions.
Even the rooms were clean, the other areas looked old and dirty.

review.title: Charged $6 per day for parking.
review.reviewText:
It's a very small hotel, more like a motel.  I was charged $6 per day for parking when no other hotel on Airport Blvd. charges for parking.

The free breakfast on Saturday was supposed to end at 10.30am.  We went down at 9:55am and found that they ran out of sausages.  When we asked for more, we were told that they were out.

review.title: Nice hotel, but aged.  Very clean, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Needed something close to town and the airport.  Very reasonable compared to others in the area.  It is not a new building, however, they kept it very clean. Good standard hotel 'hot' breakfast, waffle iron, powdered eggs, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls could use some paint.

review.title: Terrible experience.
review.reviewText: The worst customer service I have ever experienced on any hotel in my life!  Although they say the have safe boxes, they don´t, and didn´t care about my complains.  Never stay there!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: It was pleasant.
review.reviewText: It was great. Quick check in and check out. Breakfast had plenty of options and was tasty. Took a coffee for the road. I would reccomend it to anyone trying to travel to San Francisco. Also parking is $6 but that's not bad compared to other San Francisco hotels.

review.title: Great hotel with wonderful, helpful staff
review.reviewText: This is a good, reasonably priced and quiet hotel close to the airport but also easy driving distance to decent restaurants and about 20-30 minutes to downtown SF, depending on traffic (we drove it on a Saturday morning).  We had a few small requests of the staff (directions to some places, and disposing of a broken suitcase) and they were all VERY helpful and cheerful.  I would definitely stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Eating area for breakfast got a bit cramped, with so many guests trying to eat at the same time.  But the food was good.

review.title: Great hotel for early a.m. flight out of SFO.
review.reviewText: Clean and basic, but the staff beat that at a 5-star hotel--they are terrifically helpful and warm and a pleasure to stay with.  Not fancy, and great location if you need to catch and early flight out of SFO--just a 5 min. drive from car rental facility on surface roads.

review.title: Close to airport for next day flight.
review.reviewText: Friendly staff,  good accommodation, excellent breakfast.  Lack of dining places close to hotel for evening meal. Otherwise  good
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do nearby within walking distance. But suited my purpose for airport closeness

review.title: Great stay for a great price
review.reviewText: Not the best but overall a great stay for the price. Great location. Clean and the breakfast was pretty good.

review.title: Covered with bug bites
review.reviewText:
Nothing "quality" about this place. 
1) They do not have a dedicated airport shuttle as mentioned in the description. You call the hotel when you arrive at the airport and they give you the number for a cab company. You then have to call the cab company to schedule a pick up. While the hotel pays for this, the service takes forever. After waiting 20 minutes for a cab (while dozens of cabs from other companies were lined up waiting), I finally gave up on this option and took a cab of my choosing. 

2) While a free breakfast is included with your stay, there is no restaurant. So if you arrive late your options are limited.

3) When I awoke the next morning, my legs were covered with bug bites. They were extremely itchy and swollen. I don't think they were fleas since those typically bite around your waistband and ankles and these were more in a line down the sides of my legs. Couldn't shave my legs for the rest of the weekend due to the sores, and I was leaving for the beach so this effectively ruined my vacation.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wi-fi

review.title: Convenient, nice staff, room a bit 'tired'
review.reviewText: Fast and easy checkin with friendly staff. The breakfast was sufficient and typical for Quality Inn - so no issues there.  The room itself was reasonable in size and was clean. The mini fridge worked well and was quiet which was nice. The bed and bedding, carpet, etc, were a bit tired looking.
review.positiveRemarks: Very easy to get to SFO in the morning.  Free parking.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: I can't rave enough about this hotel. The staff was very informative and helpful. Rooms were spacious and clean! Breakfast was perfect and fresh! Amazing experience! Wifi was available and worked well. Bed was amazing and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: I was very concerned about being so close to the airport and hearing all the planes go by and it was NOT an issue at all.  Slept well and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: More then one luggage carrier. Parking should be FREE, there is no parking lot or garage to charge customers for.
review.locationRemarks: Near the freeway. Near airport. Near LUCKYS... must go if you can!

review.title: Decent Price for the area, fairly clean, hard beds
review.reviewText: We needed a place last minute and we were able to get a decent price on the hotel. The beds were hard and uncomfortable but the hotel seemed clean and the breakfast was pretty good.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, closeness to the airport, and the breakfast was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds are hard
review.locationRemarks: Easy airport access, not far from the city or Stanford.

review.title: convenient close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Clean relatively comfortable room, little noisy.  Staff courteous and friendly. Great breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience, pricing
review.negativeRemarks: new windows to dampen noise of street and airport

review.title: Nice hotel near SFO international
review.reviewText: No frills, reasonable price , good size room, hot breakfast and friendly staff. Stayed 6 nights to visit family and friends in the Bay Area. The only downside is they charge for parking.

review.title: Nice airport hotel with great staff
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent two nights at the Quality Inn on our way to and from Hawaii during our honeymoon. Maria at the service desk was excellent and very friendly … she even remembered us when we checked in on the way home! A free airport shuttle service was provided … however, you have to call the hotel first to have the shuttle pick you up. The shuttle is actually a taxi, run by Yellow Cab Taxi Co., and it picks you up at the front of the taxi line … NOT the hotel shuttle pick-up area. We had no problem with the taxi; in fact, the same cab driver took us to Fisherman’s Wharf, although not for free. Hotel was clean, but undergoing renovations. Nothing out of the ordinary … just a normal airport hotel. Good value.

review.title: comfortable, ffriendly staff, handy to airport
review.reviewText:
lots of traffic but fine to sleep with window closed. handy to to airport for a rest between flights
Bus route to downtown San Francisco is near hotel. Bed was comfy.
Breakfast would have been more appreciated if a gluten free cereal was provided, the eggs and apples and bananas were nice
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to airport and bus route, clean, good water pressure for shower, friendly front desk personnel Comfortable bed and soft pillows
review.negativeRemarks: would have liked some gluten free cereal for breakfast and plain yogourt without a lot of weird additives like aspartame
review.locationRemarks: handy to airport, comfy bed to sleep and recover after long flight handy to bus that took us into central San Francisco

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel two nights! Staff was kind, room was clean and nice and quiet (except for the planes from the airport - haha - but that didnt bother us at all). The room was exactly what we needed, somewhere safe to keep our things while we were out exploring, and then a place to sleep and unwind after a fun day out in the city. The breakfast in the morning was very nice! I would recommend this hotel. As far as location it is very easy to get to, just get off highway and go a few blocks, and so therefore the on ramp to the freeways is also very close which is quite convenient!

review.title: Great value with friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Indeed, Quality Inn is a budget hotel but we got Four Seasons service (and we have stayed there). The staff was warm, friendly and extremely helpful. There is no question that this stay had a high ROI. We would stay here again just to interact with the staff. The room we were staying in is in need of a refresh but the Inn is in the process of doing each floor so by the time we return all the rooms will be updated and refreshed.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the recommendation for dinner.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been good to know that you take a cab to the Inn and then get reimbursed. We waited for a shuttle and had to call when one didn't show.
review.locationRemarks: This is just an off airport hotel. Check before you go because we had to take a cab but the hotel reimbursed us for the expense.

review.title: Cheap, Convenient Hote Close To Airport.
review.reviewText: Decent Price For Budget Room. Bed, BEdding, And Mattress Were Substandard.

review.title: Review of my Quality Inns experience
review.reviewText: Overall, my experience was good. The staff, parking, and rooms were better than expected. The heater could've provided a little better temperature control- seemed old. My one complaint was that I decided to leave a day early and they do not offer refunds (I knew that was a possibility when I asked but it would have been nice to have that option).
review.positiveRemarks: The friendliness of the staff was amazing especially the guy who worked days.
review.negativeRemarks: Heat

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very Nice
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to get to bowling tournament in Daly City

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: I arrived late, with only ten hours to spend at the Quality Inn. I want to praise the guy at the reception desk, who gave me yogurt and a banana and helped me print my boarding pass for an early morning flight. He told me how long it would take to get to the airport, arranged my cab and fixed up a wake-up call. He was the height of gracious service!
review.positiveRemarks: the help
Nice access to the Bay Trail for running -- Unbroken run of about 5 miles (one-way) up north towards San Francisco, so roundtrip of 10 miles.

review.reviewText: room is large, but no so clean, there is some smell.

review.title: Worth your money!
review.reviewText: I stayed here as a place to crash and it was definitely worth the cheap price we paid. It wasn't dirty, room was clean, bed was comfortable and room was a great size with a patio to enjoy! Breakfast is chaotic because it's only one waffle machine but it's better than nothing-just get there on time!!

review.title: misrepresented shuttle service.
review.reviewText: The web page indicated that their was an airport shuttle. For SFO hotel shuttle pick-up is on departure level. Waited half an hour, called hotel and was told that they need to get a cab for pick-up. had to wait another half hour for cab pick-up. Food was terrible, nothing like the picture on the website
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was helpful. Wifi was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't offer free shuttle if it's not available.
review.locationRemarks: Industrial are with nothing to do.

review.title: Good value, especially if proximity to SFO matters
review.reviewText: Manager courteously accommodated our request to check in early. Room was very clean. Adjusting the thermostat was a mystery, but in fairness we ever asked how to do it, 'cause the temp was fine. The Quality Inn breakfast was decent - waffles, breakfast breads, cereal, some fresh fruit. Inexplicably, there's a "See's Candy" retail store next door. Go figure. Basically, if you're looking for a predictably clean, friendly, no-frills place near the Airport, this'll do. Freeway access is super easy, so you can get to anywhere without too much hassle. We used it as the jumping-off spot for a tour of USF, Santa Clara University, and St. Mary's College, and it was right in the middle. It's also conveniently located to the warehouse district where they film "Mythbusters" (Google Earth "M5 Industries") :)
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, friendly. Decent breakfast. Efficient service. Proximity to IHOP a plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really. The neighborhood seems a little sketchy at night, but hey, if you CHOOSE a motel right next to the airport, what do you expect?
review.locationRemarks: Right next to SFO airport. Eat at IHOP. Eat at Denny's. Eat at McDonald's. Get on freeway. Visit Mythbusters, but don't expect them to open the door.

review.title: Good comfortable stay near SF Airport.
review.reviewText: Good comfortable stay; well located near SF Airport.

review.title: Absolutely amazing service
review.reviewText: Nina was absolutely amazing. So helpful great directions into the city. Tim was also exceptionally hospitable at breakfast. Nothing was to much trouble. After being dropped at the wrong hotel and having to walk ten blocks to Quality Inn we were in for a great stay. Thank you so much. Will definitely recommend to all I meet. Cheers Trudy.
review.positiveRemarks: The service.
review.locationRemarks: About 1/2hr from the city but we enjoyed the public service bus ride as we got to see a lot of San Francisco

review.title: a little bit disappointed.
review.reviewText: When we arrived the hotel around 3, the rooms are not ready. we have to wait. Additionally, The towels are not clear, and the color is a little bit yellow. I won't stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, Good breakfasts, good internet connection

review.reviewText: very good and have it a good view , peasing, and very closed to the airport
review.positiveRemarks: view
review.negativeRemarks: pilows

review.title: Convenient for travelers
review.reviewText:
My flight arrived at 10 pm; my room was ready, no problem checking in. I requested an early morning wake up call, and was on my way. On the tail end of my trip, I again spent the night, and had enough time to have breakfast there. Waffles, eggs, sausage, cereals, fruit, breads were available. I was happy to find muffins cut in quarters! Perfect size for me.

Please be advised that free transportation is offered to and from SFO, but you must use a pay phone or cell phone to call them. You will be picked up at the head of the taxi queue, and NOT at the hotel shuttles area.
review.positiveRemarks: The ease of check-in and check-out.
review.negativeRemarks: Initial confusion about "shuttle" service

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText:
The suite room is pretty small.
Furnishing looks out dated.
Can't get WiFi signal in our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Small suite room and out dated furnishing

review.title: GOOD LOCATION IN SAN FRAN
review.reviewText: HOTEL WAS CLOSE TO SAN FRAN AND CANDLE STICK PARK EASY ACCESS TO FREEWAY... FRONT DESK WAS VERY VERY NICE AND HELPFUL... COMPLIMENTARY BREAKFAST WAS ALOT BETTER THEN EXPECTED HAD LOTS TO CHOOSE FROM NOT JUST MUFFINS LIKE MOST PLACES. AND PRICE WAS VERY GOOD. ONLY THING WAS I THINK COUCH IN ROOM NEEDS TO BE EXCHANGED OUT FOR NEW ONE.
review.positiveRemarks: THE BREAKFAST
review.negativeRemarks: THE COUCH IN THE ROOM
review.locationRemarks: GREAT CLOSE TO FREEWAY AND ABOUT 10 FROM DOWNTOWN

review.title: Great hotel, pleasent stay
review.reviewText: Well kept rooms, they were clean and the hotel had plenty of parking area for guests. Also the breakfast buffet was nice, and they staff were constantly putting out new/fresh items. The breakfast had a lot of options and was more than enough choices to make a good meal out of.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: I liked it. Everyone was friendly. Everything was clean. Only problem is that it's not in the city, and you have to log back into the wifi every ten minutes.

review.title: Satisfactory hotel
review.reviewText: Overall it was exactly what we expected. Very convenient for the airport and San Francisco. There were plenty of adequate restaurants nearby in easy walking distance. The breakfast was good and so was the coffee making appliance in the room which is not standard elsewhere. Also despite the closeness to the airport, the aircraft noise wasn't an issue.
review.positiveRemarks: The coffee machine in the room.

review.title: Need more staff
review.reviewText: Great location, good neighbourhood, breakfast could do with some additional staff to keep things topped up
review.positiveRemarks: Nice quite room
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast needed additional staffing
review.locationRemarks: Good neighbourhood quite dispute being close to interstate

review.title: Hard to get to and only "ok".
review.reviewText: The breakfast nook wasn't well cared for. They ran out of coffee and were very slow at refilling it and the food was marginal.

review.title: Ok for short stay, close to airport
review.reviewText: Good hotel for one or two nights espeically if you have an early flight. Very close to airport but in an industrial area with nothing close by so you need a car. Less expensive than a hotel in the city. Rooms were clean. Breakfast so so. Good value for the $$, but not really a great place for tourists.

review.title: Great place to stay, close to freeway
review.reviewText: The room was great, the food was great, the bed and pillows were great. The only negative thing was I couldn't have the window open without hearing the airplanes. There were not very many though so it worked out. The hotel is right between two freeway entrances which made it very handy. There were plenty of eateries close by. We used our phone and Garmen to find what we wanted to eat or ate in the city. The staff were very friendly and were eager to please. We used a San Francisco "Go Card" for almost all of our expeditions into the city. I save $155 per person using the go card to cruise the bay, go into the museums, do the open top bus tour, got the discount book from Pier 39 free from the Go Card which saved us on our purchases on the pier. If your driving the parking is cheaper on Beach street, especially if you get into town before 10am.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, good hot breakfast that included more than hot waffles.
review.negativeRemarks: The thermostate in our room
review.locationRemarks: Right between two different freeways, close food nearby.

review.title: It served a purpose.
review.reviewText: We checked in at midnight which was not ideal but thats what time our flight come in,we were picked up by the hotel which was nice but once we got to hotel we were greeted by a rude staff member and considering we had just flown 7 hrs with a 18 mth old it really upset us.We thought i may have just been a bad night for him but he was rude the next day as well so i guess it was just him.Overall we really liked the hotel it was what you except for an airport hotel and it had a a great continental breakfast which made it a nice place to stay for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Continental breakfast was delightful
review.negativeRemarks: The rude staff member
review.locationRemarks: All the airport hotels are within 1/2 mile of each other.

review.title: Call the hotel for a free cab ride... no problem.
review.reviewText: There is NO FREE SHUTTLE, so don't stand there at the Airport waiting for one. They have an ongoing disagreement with the taxi cartel (very understandable). Just call the hotel and they will come in a cab and get you. Not really a big problem, but there is NO FREE SHUTTLE at the airport for this hotel. The cab ride was free... and that was OK. They were right there, and brought me back... no problem.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price
review.negativeRemarks: Not a free shuttle.... however, they provided a cab.
review.locationRemarks: Near enough to the airport to be very convenient.

review.title: Convenient for a layover
review.reviewText: Good hotel for a SFO layover. Very close to the airport. Hotel is basic but clean and staff are friendly. However, the shuttle does not run on a regular schedule so you will have to phone ahead to arrange something.

review.title: You will be happy
review.reviewText: Hotel provides good service. Main breakfast alternates between scrambled eggs and bisquicks and gravy - would like more variety.

review.title: ok hotel good breakfast
review.reviewText: I only stay 1 night and didnt have a really good sleep, mattress is little bit hard, the room was ok with microwave and mini-fridge. Breakfast was good and location is close to airport which is my primary reason why I stay on this hotel. overall this is an ok hotel.

review.title: I'd pick this hotel again
review.reviewText: It's perfect and convenient if you have a long layover between flights, very close to the airport.

review.title: this Hotel was fine and close to the airport
review.reviewText: Hotel was resonably clean and there was (albeit somewhat scant) breakfast which was included.

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: great for the one night we were there... Awesome waffles!! Check in was faboulous and the gentleman at the front desk was very kind, thoughtful and knowledgeable... Great Experince

review.title: Adequate - Bed So-So
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in a convenient spot, but not the greatest neighborhood. Staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel room was cleaned sufficiently. The bed was not very comfortable, but adequate. Breakfast buffet was only okay, they need to upgrade some of their equipment (waffle iron was old and could not make waffles without sticking).

review.title: Just okay.
review.reviewText: Older hotel needs a little updating. Continental breakfast was good, but limited. Staff was not rude, but they were not overly friendly or accommodating. Our stay was just okay. With so many really nice Quality Inns around, I would not stay at this particular hotel again.

review.title: Nice hotel for a reasonable price
review.reviewText: We checked in late and left early so we were not there for a long time. It completely met our expectations (except that the TV did not work). It's a nice clean place that is not fancy but does the job for a overnight or short business stay. The internet connection was fast and free. The breakfast was simple but included hot food and so that was nice. I would stay there again without a second thought.

review.title: Good inexpensive place near SFO
review.reviewText: The service at the hotel desk were very nice and helpful, explained a lot how to get around. The free shuttle to SFO is nice, you can ride there to get on to BART to SF downtown.

review.title: Good hotel for good price
review.reviewText: We spend only one night in that hotel. So there is no bad comment about that place. I can recommend it. Breakfast was not the five stars standard but good enough.

review.title: Good location, good price
review.reviewText: Very close to airport ( but without the noise ), this place is ideally situated for an overnight stay close to SFO, and to catch an early flight the next morning. Close to rental car return. Very efficient shuttle to the airport. Room with 2 queen beds ( a rarity it seems ). For the price, can't complain! Not many restaurants nearby, though. I will probably stay there again, if needed.

review.title: Close and Convenient
review.reviewText: Found this to be VERY convenient to the airport for an early a.m. flight out. Shuttle service timely as described by hotel. This allowed us to return our rental car the p.m. before, rest comfortably and stress free.

review.title: Unbelievably rude front desk staff
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel memorial day weekend. The rooms were nice enough, but the hotel staff went out of their way to make us feel uncomfortable. They followed us out of the hotel, insisted we tell them how many people were staying in the room and what the nature of our visit to San Francisco was. We told them it was just us and that we were headed out of the hotel for the evening anyways and would only be returning to sleep-- questions we should not have had to answer. Then they continued staring at us while we waited by the front door for our taxi, which made the long wait excruciating and uncomfortable. If you want your privacy respected, AVOID THIS HOTEL.

review.title: Better Than Expected
review.reviewText: I chose the Quality Inn for convenience to SFO and because it had free wifi. I was very pleasantly surprised by the attentive care I was given by the staff, the extremely comfortable bed (wonderful sheets!!!) and the microwave in the room. Because I had a very early departure the next day, the inn arranged (and paid for!) a cab to the airport instead of having to use a shuttle. I only stayed one night but would happily stay here longer for easy access to the city in addition to the airport.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Close to the Airport and freeway. It took only 15 minutes to get to the downtown area. Very quiet. The buffet breakfast was very well served and the dining room bright and clean. Staff was very helpful.

review.title: I Left My Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I always worry about booking a hotel on-line especially when I know nothing about it or the franchise. We were pleasantly surprised! The woman working that night was just as helpful as all get out - a nice quirky sense of humor which you must have to deal with my corny husband! :) She got us extra towels and shampoo etc. The one drawback - she recommended a restaurant down the street at ANOTHER hotel. Don't go. The food was really a poor quality and pretty spendy for what you don't get. The room was great - it was located at the front of the building off the main street - but never heard any traffic. Never heard any airplanes. Never heard our neighbors. Very nice place - very nice people. Oh and the breakfast was tasty too!

review.title: Has seen it's better days go by...
review.reviewText: I would not go back to this hotel unless I had no other choice. The building is rundown and beat-up. It just felt dirty, as if no matter how much you cleaned it, it just would not come clean anymore. I found a USED wash rag hanging from the top of the shower curtain that fell down on me when I got in the shower. Disgusting. It was obviously missed by the cleaning person. I can forgive minor things, but missing a used wash rag is unacceptable to me.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: it was a great hotel to stay at. Being a three story hotel, the first floor was quiet. made for good sleep

review.title: Value for money hotel at a distance from centre
review.reviewText: We stayed here for two nights and overall we are quite happy with it. The only problem is there is no public transport to go downtown and the only way you have to do it is take the free Hotel shuttle (they have a really nice frequent service) to Airport and take the Bart from there, but the art is quite expensive and there is no day pass or 3 days pass etc. The breakfast is nice but if you go after 9 they often run out of most of the stuff and juices. However the hotel stuff were very helpful and one person even gave us a lift on his personal car to the nearest shopping centre as Shuttle was not available at that time. Overall nice hotel at a cheap price if you don't mind commuting.

review.title: Could be better, could be worse.
review.reviewText: This hotel was ok. I stayed for one night. The lady at the front desk was all smiles and very helpful. The had everything I could have needed, such as a fridge and microwave, lots of tv channels, coffee pot, soap and shampoo, etc. You can see in some places that the hotel has been used ALOT. Wallpaper peeling away in some spots, trim chipped and cracked in some spots, etc. The face to face service was good, but I found washrag in my room that had been used by prior tenants. It wasn't really dirty or gross, but it was on top of the shower curtain. I found it when i got in the shower pulled the curtain to enclose the shower. It never moved or fell down and I didn't touch it. But it was obviously used and overlooked by the cleaning staff. I told the lady at the front desk about it when I checked out. Other than the washrag, the hotel was fine. I will probably look for a different hotel before I stay at this one again.

review.title: Only good if you want to be close to the SF airport
review.reviewText: Room had a bad smell of cleaning solutions.

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText: I was very happy to find this hotel when I saw that it had a rating above 4 out of 5 and was so close to SFO and so cheap. Well, I have no idea where the rest of you people stayed...but the Quality Inn I stayed at barely deserved half that rating. So many things in the room were missing or broke (and its wasn't just my room because I overheard another guest at the front desk complaining of the same thing). The rooms were not nice at all. Beds were so-so comfort-wise. The place was just dark and dungy. I wouldn't stay there again - despite the location and cheap price.

review.title: Best value closest to SFO airport
review.reviewText: Always clean, always pleasant service, always the closest accommodations to SFO airport ( long term parking within a short walking distance!)

review.title: Would not hesitate to go back to it
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised because the hotel only had a 2 and a half star rating, but I would give it a 4 star rating. The continental breakfast was good and having a microwave and refrigerator in the room was handy. The location of the hotel was also conveniently located to the airport and freeway, yet it was very quiet and kind of cozy, because it is a small hotel.

review.title: Free Wi-Fi & Lots of TV Channels
review.reviewText: This hotel is located just north of SFO, near the rental car terminal. It's also located right next to the 101 fwy, so it was easy to hop onto the freeway to get to the city. All of the restaurants near by are sit-down (IHOP, Dennys, Red Robins) and couldn't find drive-thru fast food places which would have been convenient when you're trying to catch a flight. Free wi-fi internet access, but no LAN access. Login & password are listed in the room, so you don't have to call the front desk. Lots of cable channels (80 with local), including Food Network, Discovery Channel & Animal Planet.
